name: Palindrome check
description: Check whether a given string is a palindrome (reads the same forwards and backwards).

input_output.output_description: True if the string is a palindrome, False otherwise.

steps: Convert the string to a normalized form (e.g. lowercase).
Compare the normalized string with its reversed version.
If they are equal, the string is a palindrome.

usage_snippet:
s = "Level"
normalized = s.lower()
reversed_s = normalized[::-1]
is_palindrome = (normalized == reversed_s)

explanation.title: Normalization
explanation.text: The string is converted to lowercase to make the comparison case-insensitive.

explanation.title: Reversing with slicing
explanation.text: The slice syntax s[::-1] returns a reversed copy of the string.

explanation.title: Comparison
explanation.text: If the normalized string equals its reversed version, it is a palindrome.

variations: Strip spaces and punctuation before checking.
Check palindromes in sentences by removing non-letter characters.
Return the reversed string along with the boolean result.
